duties_responsibilities.duty: Administration of on-campus and in-office recruiting efforts
Create and implement marketing strategies tailored to each school with support from school teams
Plan and execute formal and informal presentations, career fairs, receptions, and dinners
Manage relationship development of candidates by overseeing communication and correspondence throughout the year
Manage school budgets, including event expense tracking, organization sponsorships, and annual updates
Manage Job Postings and Candidate Selection process including interview logistics
Support the offer process and own the candidate experience as the face of Altamont
Support Altamont employees involved in recruiting with timely updates, support interview training, and coordination of commitments
Assist in evaluating the success of each recruiting season; prepare and analyze statistics, evaluate school success, use statistics/data to recommend process changes and improvements
Own, plan, execute, and attend various elements of Acceptee Weekend; interacting with incoming interns and full-time hires
Help plan, organize, and manage the summer internship programs
Create and attend summer social events
Support Summer Training Program Lead
Coordinate with Portfolio Companies as needed and assist in gathering feedback
Coordinate Final Presentations and Interview Schedules
Manage travel logistics
Engage and coordinate contact with incoming hires; helping to assist in start date and initial onboarding training and paperwork
Serve as point of contact on LinkedIn/Social Media/PR efforts and ownership of the recruiting email inbox
Utilize recruit tracking system for data entry, event management, and reporting in a timely & accurate manner
Perform other administrative duties as requested or as responsibilities dictate

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Recruiting, HR, or a related field (Master's preferred)
